column1: Sentence
Mikhail Borisovich Korniyenko (?????? ????????? ?????????; born April 15, 1960) is a Russian cosmonaut.
Korniyenko was born in Syzran, Kuybyshev Oblast, Russian SFSR.
He is married to Irina Kornienko, a physician.

column2: They have a grown daughter.

column1: His father, Boris G. Kornienko, a military pilot, perished in an airplane crash in 1965.
His mother, Faina M. Kornienko born in 1931 is retired.
Korniyenko graduated from secondary school No. 15, Chelyabinsk; Russia, in 1977.

column2: From 1981 to 1987 he studied at the Moscow Aviation Institute named after S. Ordzhonikidze.

column1: Upon graduation from school in 1977, he worked at a radio equipment plant in Chelyabinsk, Russia.
In May 1978, Korniyenko was called to service in the Soviet Army.
He served in the paratrooper forces in Kirovobad, Azerbaidzhan, the USSR.
In May 1980, he completed his military service with the rank of a junior sergeant.

column2: Kornienko worked for the Moscow Militia from 19801986.
At the same time he attended the evening Department of Moscow Aviation Institute.

column1: Upon graduation in 1987 from the institute, he was qualified as a liquid propellant rocket engines mechanical engineer.
He resigned from the Militia in 1986 and entered a mechanical engineering design bureau.
During 1986 to 1991 Korniyenko worked in the Baikonur Launch Facility as a launch equipment specialist.
He worked for commercial companies between late 1991 to early 1995.

column2: From October 1991 to December 1992 he was the OOO Transvostok Technical and Production Department Director.
From January 1993 to April 1995 he was the LLC ESTE General Director.

column1: In October 1995, Kornienko started working at the Energia Rocket/Space Corporation (RSC) as an engineer.
He was assigned with developing technical documentation for cosmonaut primary and backup crew tests and training.
He took part in EVA tests in simulated zero-gravity at the hydrolab and at the Selen dynamic stand.

column2: In the process of this work he acquired experience in organizing extravehicular repair/refurbishment and assembly activities on the Mir orbital station.

column1: He also directly participated in testing the Energia RSC production on the testing ground.
On February 24, 1998, Kornienko was selected as a test cosmonaut candidate and, in 1991, following basic training at the Yu.
Gagarin Cosmonaut Training Center, he was qualified as a test cosmonaut.
Since 1999, he has trained in the International Space Station group.
He served on the ISS Expedition 8 backup crew as a flight engineer.
In 2005, he was assigned to the Soyuz TMA-10 and Expedition 15 back-up crew as Flight Engineer 1.
Kornienko was aboard the space station as a Flight Engineer, being part of the Expedition 23/24 crew.

On July 27, 2010 Kornienko and fellow Russian cosmonaut Fyodor Yurchikhin participated in a spacewalk outside the ISS.

column2: The two cosmonauts on July 23 put on their Orlan spacesuits and performed a dry run of the spacewalk activities.

column1: From inside the Pirs docking compartment they checked out the Orlan systems, practiced translation movements and tested their mobility.
During the spacewalk, Kornienko and Yurchikhin outfitted the Rassvet module's (MRM1) Kurs automated rendezvous system, installed cables and remove and replaced a video camera.

column2: null
It was the 25th Russian spacewalk performed from the station.

column1: About an hour later, another unidentified item, appeared to be a washer accidentally floated off.

column2: The spacewalk lasted six hours and 42 minutes.
